Try to change following lines and it should work, I get it to work as you the way you describe it.

    $username = $_GET['username'];
    $userpassword = $_GET['password'];
 
    $username = mysql_real_escape_string($username);
    $userpassword = mysql_real_escape_string($userpassword);

And my output is `{"success":1}`

Let me know If this works for you. I would have a lot of suggestion to your code later when you get this done.

    $username = $_GET['username'];

    $username = mysql_real_escape_string($username);
    $userpassword = mysql_real_escape_string($userpassword);

And my output is `{"success":1}`

And change `if ($row['total'] == 1) {` to `if ($row) {`

Let me know If this works for you. I would have a lot of suggestion to your code later when you get this done.

Try to change following lines and it should work, I get it to work as you the way you describe it.

1- 

    $username = $_GET['username'];
    $userpassword = $_GET['password'];
 
    $username = mysql_real_escape_string($username);
    $userpassword = mysql_real_escape_string($userpassword);

Here you will get URL parameters and sanitize.

2- Change `$row = mysql_fetch_assoc($result);`

to `$total_rows = mysql_num_rows($result);`

Here you count how many rows you have

3- And change `if ($row['total'] == 1) {` to `if ($total_rows == 1) {`

Here you check if you have at least 1 row.

That should give output `{"success":1}`

**Note:** This is to solve your request and question, but does not necessary means the right approach or perfect solution in general.

I would suggest you think of password hashing, post method in stead of get, use mysqli or PDO in sted of mysql and input sensitization and not use URL to pass username and password.
